title: How to Clean Up your Safari Reading List on Mac: Step-by-Step Guide

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. You can do so by clicking the Safari application on your dock, double-clicking it on your desktop, or opening it from a Finder window in the Applications folder. The Safari icon looks like a silver compass with a blue face.

steps.title: Click the sidebar button.
steps.content: Click the sidebar button. This button looks like a rectangle split into two sections, and it's located in the upper-left corner of the window next to the browser's back and forward arrows.

steps.title: Click Reading List in the sidebar.
steps.content: Click Reading List in the sidebar. It's the second option from the top and has an icon that looks like a pair of round glasses. Alternatively you can open the Reading List when Safari is open by clicking View in the top bar and then selecting Show Reading List Sidebar .

steps.title: Press Ctrl and click any item on your Reading List.
steps.content: Press Ctrl and click any item on your Reading List. If you only want to remove one item, make sure to Ctrl + click on the correct item. A contextual menu will pop up with a variety of options. Ctrl + click is how to right-click on a Mac computer.

steps.title: Select Remove Item or Clear All Items….
steps.content: Select Remove Item or Clear All Items… . To remove an individual item from your Reading List, you'd want to select Remove Item . If you want to clear your entire Reading List, select Clear All Items… [1] X Research source You can also clear your Reading List by Ctrl + clicking on your Reading List sidebar background and selecting Clear All Items… If you opt to clear all items, Safari will confirm if you want to clear your Reading List. Click the blue Clear button to finish clearing the list.

steps.title: Click the sidebar button again to close the sidebar.
steps.content: Click the sidebar button again to close the sidebar. If you don't want your sidebar to remain open, simply click the sidebar button again to close it.
